com.ericsson.oss.itpf.datalayer.dps.query.spi

Interface QueryService


  • public interface QueryService
    Service responsible for dealing with query related features of Data Persistence Service.
    Since:
    1.0.217

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      Executes the query and presents the result as a list.

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        <T> java.util.List<T> execute(DpsQuery<?> query,
                              java.lang.String bucketName)
        Executes the query and presents the result as an iterator of objects queried for. Will always return the full object from the database.

        The resultant execution can not guarantee the order, unless the query itself defines it (e.g. is ordered in any way). Two executions of this method with the same unordered query can produce two iterators with different order of objects.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of objects returned by the execution of the query. It is the responsibility of the users of this method to do the right type casting, according to the type of query executed
        Parameters:
        query - query to be executed
        bucketName - the name of the data bucket in which the query will be executed against.
        Returns:
        a list of objects queried for.

      • executeProjection

        <T> java.util.List<T> executeProjection(DpsQuery<?> query,
                                        com.ericsson.oss.itpf.datalayer.dps.query.projection.Projection projection,
                                        java.lang.String bucketName)
        Executes the query and presents the result as a list. Returns a list, the type of which is based on the Projection used. For example if the projection retrieve an attribute of type Integer, then the list will be of type Integer also. It is the responsibility of the users of this method to do the right type of casting.

        The resultant execution can not guarantee the order, unless the query itself defines it (e.g. is ordered in any way). Two executions of this method with the same unordered query can produce two lists with different order.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of objects returned by the execution of the query. It is the responsibility of the users of this method to do the right type casting depending on the data type of the attribute or object field involved in the projection
        Parameters:
        query - query to be executed
        projection - projection for the retrieved value
        bucketName - the name of the data bucket in which the query will be executed against.
        Returns:
        a list. The type of the list will be defined by the projections used.

      • executeProjection

        java.util.List<java.lang.Object[]> executeProjection(DpsQuery<?> query,
                                                     com.ericsson.oss.itpf.datalayer.dps.query.projection.Projection initialProjection,
                                                     java.lang.String bucketName,
                                                     com.ericsson.oss.itpf.datalayer.dps.query.projection.Projection... furtherProjections)
        Executes the query and presents the result as a list. Will return a projection with an List on which the type of data will be an Object array. The order of the attributes in the returned array will be the same order as the supplied projections. It is the responsibility of the users of this method to do the right type casting. Example: if it is applied a projection for poId and fdn, the returned object array will contain the poId (Long type) in the position 0 and the fdn (String type) in the position 1.

        The resultant execution can not guarantee the order, unless the query itself defines it (e.g. is ordered in any way). Two executions of this method with the same unordered query can produce two lists with different order.

        Parameters:
        query - query to be executed
        initialProjection - the first projection for the retrieved value
        bucketName - the name of the data bucket in which the query will be executed against.
        furtherProjections - the further projections to be applied as retrieving values
        Returns:
        a list of Object array.

      • executeCount

        java.lang.Long executeCount(DpsQuery<?> query,
                            java.lang.String bucketName)
        Executes the query and presents the result as a count of how many instances are matched against the query.
        Note: because of database limitations, at this moment this method is not optimized.
        Parameters:
        query - query to be executed
        bucketName - the name of the data bucket in which the query will be executed against.
        Returns:
        the number of instances that matches against the supplied query

      • executeDeletion

        void executeDeletion(DpsQuery<?> query,
                     java.lang.String bucketName)
        Deletes all matching objects and where appropriate deletes any related managed object.
        Note: because of database limitations, at this moment this method is not optimized.
        Parameters:
        query - query that identifies the objects to be deleted.
        bucketName - the name of the data bucket in which the query will be executed against.
